questions.question: 1. A direct shear test was conducted on a cohesion-less soil (C = 0) specimen under a normal stress (σ) of 200 kN/m<sup>2</sup>. The specimen failed at a shear stress (S) of 100 kN/m<sup>2</sup>. Determine the angle of internal friction of the soil (in degrees).

explanations.a: We rearrange the equation for shear strength to solve for θ as: Angle of internal friction, θ = tan<sup>-1</sup>(S / σ). We ignore C as it is 0.
explanations.b: We rearrange the equation for shear strength to solve for θ as: Angle of internal friction, θ = tan<sup>-1</sup>(S / σ). We ignore C as it is 0.
explanations.c: We rearrange the equation for shear strength to solve for θ as: Angle of internal friction, θ = tan<sup>-1</sup>(S / σ). We ignore C as it is 0.
explanations.d: We rearrange the equation for shear strength to solve for θ as: Angle of internal friction, θ = tan<sup>-1</sup>(S / σ). We ignore C as it is 0.

questions.question: 2. A direct shear test was conducted on a cohesion less soil (C = 0) specimen under a normal stress (σ) of 96.6 kN/m<sup>2</sup>. The angle of internal friction (θ) of the soil is 35<sup>o</sup>. The specimen fails at a shear stress of ____.

explanations.a: We use the formula: shear strength, S = C + σ * tanθ
explanations.b: We use the formula: shear strength, S = C + σ * tanθ
explanations.c: We use the formula: shear strength, S = C + σ * tanθ
explanations.d: We use the formula: shear strength, S = C + σ * tanθ
